critique: This document establishes a Board of Inquiry to address a labor dispute. It doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, or social inclusion. It invokes executive power to intervene in a labor dispute that is deemed to imperil national health and safety. It doesn't explicitly favor state or federal control but uses federal law. It balances national health and safety with labor rights, and it involves government intervention in the economy to resolve a labor dispute. It has no bearing on social inclusion.
